skillTree.localised_description: As part of the binding ritual, Screamer bodies are flattened and transmuted into unlikely aspects.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Hurtling across the realms like incandescent meteors, Burning Chariots bring Tzeentch's emissaries to the foe.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

skillTree.localised_description: Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Destiny calls.
The unified forces of Chaos thrill the Lord of Change, who delights in seeing once-fierce enemies transformed into a weapon of untold annihilation.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

skillTree.localised_description: Although it can be said that they have failed His tests, the broken minds and fluctuating, mutated bodies of Tzeeneth's lesser minions still have their uses.

skillTree.localised_description: Unburdened by mass, Tzeentch's flaming servants surge toward the foe – the heralds of their utter doom, no less.

skillTree.localised_description: Even the bravest, most rational souls waver in the hideous, laughing face of their worst nightmares.

skillTree.localised_description: The flickering beings of flame are in many ways the purest servants of the Changer, for their gaseous forms are ever in a state of flux.

skillTree.localised_description: The best form of defence is attack, and the best form of attack is the one which reaches into the foe's mind and turns its contents against them.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

skillTree.localised_description: Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of Change, though it may amount to nothing more than the cruellest of tricks, ensures the forces of Tzeeneth are fed and nourished.
Tzeentch knows that at their cores all beings desire Change, and as such there are no shortage of recruits willing to march under his many-coloured banner.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.
